name: src/screenplay/abilities/ManageALocalServer.ts
ManageALocalServer
description:
An {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Ability} that enables the {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay/actor~Actor}
 to manage a local [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/) server.
examples:
<caption>Using a raw Node.js server</caption>
import { Actor } from '@serenity-js/core';
import { CallAnApi, GetRequest, Send } from '@serenity-js/rest';
import { ManageALocalServer, LocalTestServer, StartLocalTestServer, StopLocalTestServer } from '@serenity-js/local-server'
import { Ensure, equals } from '@serenity-js/assertions';

import axios from 'axios';
import * as http from 'http';

const server = http.createServer(function (request, response) {
    response.setHeader('Connection', 'close');
    response.end('Hello!');
})

const actor = Actor.named('Apisit').whoCan(
    ManageALocalServer.using(server),
    CallAnApi.using(axios.create()),
);

actor.attemptsTo(
    StartLocalTestServer.onRandomPort(),
    Send.a(GetRequest.to(LocalServer.url())),
    Ensure.that(LastResponse.status(), equals(200)),
    Ensure.that(LastResponse.body<string>(), equals('Hello!')),
    StopLocalTestServer.ifRunning(),
);

name: runningAHttpListener
description: {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Ability} to manage a Node.js HTTP server using the provided `requestListener`.

name: runningAHttpsListener
description: {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Ability} to manage a Node.js HTTPS server using the provided server `requestListener`.

name: as

params.name: protocol
params.description: Protocol to be used when communicating with the running server; `http` or `https`

params.name: server
params.description: A Node.js server requestListener, with support for [server shutdown](https://www.npmjs.com/package/http-shutdown).

name: listen
description: Starts the server on the first free port between `preferredPort` and `highestPort`, inclusive.

params.name: preferredPort
params.description: Lower bound of the preferred port range

params.name: highestPort
params.description:
highestPort
 Upper bound of the preferred port range

name: mapInstance
description: Provides access to the server requestListener

name: RequestListener
description:
A `requestListener` function that Node's
 [`http.createServer`](https://nodejs.org/api/http.html#http_http_createserver_options_requestlistener)
 or [`https.createServer`](https://nodejs.org/api/https.html#https_https_createserver_options_requestlistener)
 would accept.

name: ServerWithShutdown
description: A {@link net~Server} with an added shutdown method.

name: SupportedProtocols
description:
The protocol supported by the instance of the {@link ServerWithShutdown},
 wrapped by the {@link ManageALocalServer} {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Ability}.

name: src/screenplay/index.ts
src/screenplay/interactions/StartLocalServer.ts
StartLocalServer
description: Starts local server so that a test can interact with it.

name: onRandomPort
description: Starts local test server on a random available ports.

name: onOneOfThePreferredPorts
description:
Instructs the {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay/actor~Actor}
 to start a local test server on one of the preferred ports.

 Please note: this method is kept for backwards compatibility. However, its behaviour has changed
 and is currently identical to calling `StartLocalServer.onPort` with the first of `preferredPorts`
 passed as an argument.

params.name: preferredPorts
params.description: A list of preferred ports. Please note that only the first one will be used!

name: onPort
description:
Instructs the {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay/actor~Actor}
 to start a local test server on a `preferredPort`, or a random one if that's not available.

name: onRandomPortBetween
description:
Instructs the {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay/actor~Actor}
 to start a local test server on a random port between `lowestPort` and `highestPort`.

params.name: lowestPort
params.description: Lower bound of the preferred port range

params.name: highestPort
params.description: Upper bound of the preferred port range

name: src/screenplay/interactions/StopLocalServer.ts
StopLocalServer
description:
Stops the local server. Should be used in `afterEach` block to make sure that the server
 is correctly shut down even when the test fails.

name: ifRunning
description: Stops the server if it's running. If the server hasn't been started, this interaction does nothing.

name: performAs
description:
Makes the provided {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay/actor~Actor}
 perform this {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Interaction}.

name: toString
description: Generates a description to be used when reporting this {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Activity}.

name: src/screenplay/questions/LocalServer.ts
url
description:
Retrieves the URL of the local server started
 using the {@link StartLocalServer} {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Interaction}.

unknown.tagValue: {@serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Question<string>} Url of the locally running Node.js server

name: port
description:
Retrieves the port number of the local server started
 using the {@link StartLocalServer} {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Interaction}.

unknown.tagValue: {@serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Question<string>} port number of the locally running Node.js server

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@serenity-js/local-server",
  "version": "2.33.3",
  "description": "Enables Serenity/JS Actors to manage local Node.js test servers, such as Express, Koa or Restify",
  "author": {
    "name": "Jan Molak",
    "email": "jan.molak@smartcodeltd.co.uk",
    "url": "https://janmolak.com"
  },
  "funding": {
    "url": "https://github.com/sponsors/serenity-js"
  },
  "homepage": "https://serenity-js.org",
  "license": "Apache-2.0",
  "publishConfig": {
    "access": "public"
  },
  "main": "lib/index.js",
  "typings": "lib/index.d.ts",
  "keywords": [
    "serenity-js",
    "http",
    "rest",
    "axios",
    "tdd",
    "bdd",
    "test",
    "testing",
    "express",
    "hapi",
    "koa",
    "restify"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "clean": "rimraf .nyc_output lib target",
    "lint": "eslint --ext ts --config ../../.eslintrc.js .",
    "lint:fix": "npm run lint -- --fix",
    "test": "nyc --report-dir ../../target/coverage/rest mocha --config ../../.mocharc.yml 'spec/**/*.spec.*'",
    "compile": "tsc --project tsconfig.json",
    "site": "esdoc -c .esdoc.js"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/serenity-js/serenity-js.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/serenity-js/serenity-js/issues"
  },
  "engines": {
    "node": "^12 || ^14 || ^16",
    "npm": "^6 || ^7 || ^8"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@serenity-js/core": "2.33.3",
    "http-shutdown": "^1.2.2",
    "portfinder": "^1.0.28"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@documentation/esdoc-template": "2.0.0",
    "@hapi/hapi": "^20.2.1",
    "@integration/testing-tools": "2.0.0",
    "@serenity-js/assertions": "2.33.3",
    "@serenity-js/rest": "2.33.3",
    "@types/chai": "^4.3.0",
    "@types/express": "^4.17.13",
    "@types/hapi": "^18.0.7",
    "@types/mocha": "^9.1.0",
    "@types/restify": "^8.5.4",
    "axios": "^0.21.4",
    "express": "^4.17.3",
    "koa": "^2.13.4",
    "mocha": "^9.2.2",
    "restify": "^8.6.0",
    "semver": "^7.3.5",
    "ts-node": "^10.7.0",
    "typescript": "^4.6.2"
  },
  "nyc": {
    "include": [
      "src/**/*.ts"
    ],
    "exclude": [
      "src/**/*.d.ts",
      "lib",
      "node_modules",
      "spec"
    ],
    "extension": [
      ".ts"
    ],
    "require": [
      "ts-node/register"
    ],
    "reporter": [
      "json"
    ],
    "cache": true,
    "all": true
  }
}
